events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection. Initial details were submitted for the claim to begin processing.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on the description of the vehicle collision and related damages.
An insurance agent was successfully assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim for personalized support and faster resolution.
Acknowledgement of the auto accident claim was sent to the customer, confirming receipt and outlining the next steps in the process.
Requested necessary documents including police report, photographs of vehicle damage, and driver's license to proceed with investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents such as police report, photos, and vehicle registration in a complete and timely manner.
Investigation team began reviewing the provided evidence and statements to assess the circumstances and liabilities of the auto accident.
The investigation into the car collision was concluded and findings including fault and damage extent were documented for claim decision.
A settlement proposal was sent to the customer outlining the compensation amount based on damage assessment and policy coverage.
Customer responded with positive feedback on the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the timely communication from their agent.
The claim was officially approved following customer agreement on the settlement offer and completion of all investigatory procedures.
Insurance payment was processed and transferred to the customer to cover the vehicle repairs as detailed in the approved claim settlement.
The auto accident claim was formally closed after successful payment issuance and confirmation that all customer concerns were addressed.
All documentation and records pertaining to the auto accident claim were securely archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
